songs.title: XO TOUR Llif3
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Are you alright?
I'm alright, I'm quite alright
And my money's right
8… (yeah)
Countin' them bands
All way to the top 'til they be fallin' over
(Yeah, yeah, yeah)
Countin' them bands
On my way to the top 'til we fallin' over

[Chorus]
I don't really care if you cry
On the real, you shoulda never lied
Shoulda saw the way she looked me in my eyes
She said, "Baby, I am not afraid to die"
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge

[Verse 1]
Phantom that's all red, inside all white
Like somethin' you ride a sled down, I just want that head
My Brittany got mad, I'm barely her man now
Everybody got the same swag now
Watch the way that I tear it down
Stackin' my bands all the way to the top
All the way 'til my bands fallin' over
Every time that you leave your spot
Your girlfriend call me like, "Come on over!"
I like the way that she treat me
Gon' leave you, won't leave me, I call it that Casanova
She say I'm insane, yeah
I might blow my brain out (hey)
Xanny, help the pain, yeah
Please, Xanny, make it go away
I'm committed, not addicted, but it keep control of me
All the pain, now I can't feel it
I swear that it's slowin' me, yeah

[Chorus]
I don't really care if you cry
On the real, you shoulda never lied
Saw the way she looked me in my eyes
She said: "I am not afraid to die."
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge (yeah)
All my friends are dead, yeah, ooh
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead, yeah
All my friends are dead, yeah

[Verse 2]
That is not your swag, I swear you fake hard
Now these niggas wanna take my cadence
Rain on 'em, thunderstorm, rain on 'em (ooh, yeah)
Medicine, lil' nigga, take some (yeh, yeh)
Fast car, NASCAR, race on 'em
In the club, ain't got no ones, then we would beg them
Clothes from overseas, got the racks and they all C-Notes
You is not a G though
Lookin' at you stackin' all your money, it all green though
I was countin' that and these all twenties, that's a G-roll

[Bridge]
She say: "You're the worst, you're the worst."
I cannot die because this my universe

[Chorus]
I don't really care if you cry
On the real, you shoulda never lied
Shoulda saw the way she looked me in my eyes
She said: "Baby, I am not afraid to die."
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge
All my friends are dead
Push me to the edge

description.plain:
“XO Tour Llif3” is about Uzi’s relationship issues with ex-girlfriend, Brittany Byrd, and substance abuse. It’s delivered over bassy and upbeat production but addresses topics like suicide and betrayal.  Ultimately, it’s a narrative mixed with strong emotional dialogue, outlining a big fight between him and his girlfriend.

LUV premiered the track in London while opening for The Weeknd’s Starboy: Legend of the Fall 2017 world tour, following the song’s leak. The title pays homage to The Weeknd’s label XO, in light of the performance.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BRVujQLAHO5/?taken-by=liluzivert

songs.title: The Way Life Goes
songs.lyrics:
[Pre-Chorus]
That's true, that's right
She's sipping Moet, and yeah I swear it gets her wetter
My Louboutins new, so my bottoms, they is redder
No I'm not a rat but I'm all about my cheddar
Just talked to your homie she said we should be together
Gave me brain, was so insane that I made her my header
If she ever call my phone you know I gotta dead her
But I like that girl too much, I wish I never met her
Hello I was listening to this song
It goes like

[Chorus]
I know it hurts sometimes but you'll get over it
You'll find another life to live
I swear that you'll get over it
I know you're sad and tired
You've got nothing left to give
You'll find another life to live
I know that you'll get over it

[Verse 1]
Wish I never ever ever told you things
I was only only trying to show you things
Iced out heart on your neck trying to froze your ring
I had to get me a new bitch to hold the pain
We was in Hawaii looking at the rain
She smiling happy but I'm laughing 'cause her new man a lame
(Broke boi, broke boi, broke boi, broke boi)
That just goes to show me money don't attract a thing (real shit)
Stuck to the plan even though you used to go with my mans
Oh get over it

[Chorus]
I know it hurts sometimes but you'll get over it
You'll find another life to live
I swear that you'll get over it
I know you're sad and tired
You've got nothing left to give
You'll find another life to live
I know that you'll get over it

[Verse 2]
I tied up my RAF you strapped up your Rick
Diamonds on your neck, ice all on my wrist
Complement my style
She don't want me I'm running wild
You know I respect her on that level
She don't want me then I'ma let her
Go over there with that broke fella
Walk off my Saint Laurent, that leather
My new chick I swear that she better
Want me back, never (ooh)

[Pre-Chorus]
That's true, that's right
She's sipping Moet, and yeah I swear it gets her wetter
My Louboutins new, so my bottoms, they is redder
No I'm not a rat but I'm all about my cheddar
Just talked to your homie she said we should be together
Gave me brain, was so insane that I made her my header
If she ever call my phone you know I gotta dead her
But I like that girl too much, I wish I never met her

[Chorus: Oh Wonder & Lil Uzi Vert]
I know it hurts sometimes but you'll get over it (woah)
You'll find another life to live
I swear that you'll get over it (you'll get over it)
I know it hurts sometimes but you'll get over it (no,no)
You'll find another life to live (you will)
I know that you'll get over it (oh)

[Outro: Oh Wonder & Lil Uzi Vert]
You'll get over it
You'll get over it
You'll get over it
You'll get over it
That's true, that's right
She's sipping Moet, and yeah I swear it gets her wetter
My Louboutins new, so my bottoms, they is redder
No I'm not a rat but I'm all about my cheddar
Just talked to your homie she said we should be together
Gave me brain, was so insane that I made her my header

description.plain: In keeping with the theme of the majority of songs on the project, Uzi is presumably singing about his ex-girlfriend Brittany Byrd. Taking a melodic approach, Uzi trades his metaphor filled bars for a harmonic interpolation of Oh Wonder’s “Landslide”on the chorus. He reassures himself that despite his heartbreak, time is the ultimate healer.

songs.title: You Was Right
songs.album: Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Hit it from the back, watch a nigga bless you
(If Young Metro don't trust you I'm gon' shoot you)
Cryin' in my arms like a nigga wrecked you
(Metro Boomin' want some more, nigga)

[Hook]
Ya alright, alright, alright
You was right, I was wrong
Ya, I should've never ever took her home
Ya, I should've just boned
Ya, fantasy on my phone
Ya, hit it from the back, watch a nigga bless you
Ya, cryin' in my arms like a nigga wrecked you
Talkin' 'bout a broken heart, runnin' to the restroom

[Verse 1]
Looked at my mama just like we rich
Looked at my bitch like we rich
Said we ain't got no minor setbacks
Countin' all that money, told that nigga just to bet that
I, I know that you ain't got it, boy, why you ain't just say that?
They see I got that money, now his bitch like, "I said that"
I don't pay that ho no mind, I been had that
When I saw my girl, yeah you know I had to bag that
And before me, four niggas yeah, they had that
Five niggas includin' me, I had to back back
Try to diss me, I take it to your family
I fuck your sister then make sure that she vanish

[Hook]
Ya alright, alright, alright

description.plain:
One of two Metro Boomin produced songs on the Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World mixtape, Lil Uzi addresses relationship issues and unfaithfulness on “You Was Right.”

Future’s favorite producer provides a signature club-ready beat with an introspective tinge for Uzi’s regretful, yet ratchet, lyrics.

On March 2, 2017 “You Was Right” was certified  platinum, marking Uzi’s first ever platinum single.

description.plain:
“New Patek” is a promotional single for Lil Uzi Vert’s 2019 album Eternal Atake, but it did not make the final tracklist.

In the song, Uzi frequently references the luxury watch brand Patek Phillipe, while also bragging about his sexual encounters and accumulated wealth. He also references pop-culture icons like Naruto, Transformers, and Rey Mysterio.

The instrumental is built around a sample of the title track from the Death Parade anime series.

The song was first previewed on Instagram in June 2018, and quickly went viral. During his performance at Lollapalooza 2018, Uzi revealed the song’s title to be “5 Min,” a reference to the song’s run-time of 5:43. However, based on lyrics from the snippet, fans labeled the song as “(New) Patek,” which ultimately became the official song title.

The single artwork is a screenshot from the snippet video in which Uzi was dancing to the song. The glowing hand and the keyhole are a continuation of the Heaven’s Gate cult references present in the album artworks.

description.plain:
On “Money Longer,” Lil Uzi Vert contemplates how life has changed since he became famous. The song was first released a track on Uzi’s Soundcloud—a major promo tool for this North Philly rapper.  Now that he’s signed to Atlantic Records, Uzi is turning underground buzz into real money.

Lil Uzi Vert included “Money Longer” on Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World, a nine-song mixtape released on May 27, 2016,

“Money Longer” was produced by Philly raised Maaly Raw and Atlanta legend DJ Cannon. DJ Cannon first heard Uzi on the radio while driving through Philly.

Uzi told Vibe:

He called my phone. He followed me on Twitter. Shout out to Philly, for real.

description.plain:
This song is dedicated to Lil Uzi Vert’s girlfriend Brittany. He sings about her ex-boyfriend Austin and how he took Brittany from him. The title of the song refers to the saying “Mind your P’s and Q’s” aka mind your manners.

LUV commented on his relationship with Brittany during an interview with Nardwuar:

https://youtu.be/_8hxi2UzI9I?t=225

Lil Uzi and producer Don Cannon teased this song to fans through snippets that were posted on Snapchat & Twitter.

description.plain:
Lyle Leduff and Don Cannon team up for a slow beat on production and Uzi raps slowly, regarding social media issues, and issues that he faces with his previous friends.

The original sample is “Cufool – Pocket Love”. The sample was uploaded at looperman, in December 24, 2011. https://www.looperman.com/loops/detail/51248/pocket-love-by-cufool-free-140bpm-pop-synth-loop

description.plain:
Following issues with Atlantic Records, Nicki Minaj’s long awaited take on Lil Uzi Vert’s “The Way Life Goes” is here.

In August 2017, shortly after Uzi’s Luv Is Rage 2 dropped, Nicki asked him via Instagram to send her the beat so that she could make the remix.



The song could be about Uzi’s breakup with on-again, off-again girlfriend Brittany Byrd. The couple’s rocky relationship started in 2014. Byrd was Uzi’s stylist.



Of Brittany, Uzi once told Fader, “I’m a rapper, bro. It’s fucked up. Our relationship is fucked up.” He continued, “But, you know, I love her for her and she loves me for me. So, you know. It’s always gon’ be good.”
In 2016, Uzi announced his split with Byrd by posting some pretty dark tweets.
This song wouldn’t be the first time Uzi’s song was inspired by his breakup with Byrd, either. Fans think Lil Uzi Vert’s 2016 track “Stole Your Luv” could also be about the split.

description.plain:
20 mins the last track off of LUV Is Rage 2 (Deluxe). Here Uzi describes the first time he met his ex-girlfriend, Brittany Byrd. This song also talks about other women that have approached Uzi in his music career.

20 Min was a much awaited song by fans once Lil Uzi leaked a 30 second snippet of it. Fans could hear the last line of the pre-chorus all the way to the line “But I treat it like my city show.”

This track was popularized by DJ Day-Day’s as the first couple of seconds could be heard in his intro playing the instrumental to the words, “Day-Day you a fool for this one son.”

description.plain:
While we’re awaiting Uzi’s anticipated project Luv Is Rage 2 Lil Uzi Vert drops a new music video taking a trip to islands of Hawaii to chill in his latest music video off The Perfect LUV Tape. The video features Uzi chilling with his homies and riding dirt bikes and ATV’s around, sticking true to his hometown roots in Philly. The music video has a bit of trippy, psychedelic theme once again implying Lil Uzi is in his own universe. following his last few trippy music videos “Money Longer” and “You Was Right”.

The music video embodies “Do What I Want” lifestyle and shows Lil Uzi enjoying the fruits of his labor celebrating on vacation in Hawaii.



The music video dropped on April 27, 2017.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zqflC-as2Qo

This song was also played in the commercial for Jordan Westbrook 0.2.

https://youtu.be/k8Gsn4hWRNA

Originally titled “7AM (VLONE LIFESTYLE),” this song was renamed “7AM” for the iTunes version of Luv is Rage—VLONE is A$AP Rocky and A$AP Bari’s start-up cult fashion line, which Lil Uzi’s girlfriend, Brittany, can be seen wearing in the cover art.



Uzi’s frequent collaborator Playboi Carti also supported VLONE in his song, “VLONE Thug.”

Parts of this song mimic the melody, cadence and theme of Speaker Knockerz' “Annoying.”

description.plain:
Uzi and Pharrell collaborate to create an ode to their colorful and successful life. Ripe with references to happiness and wealth, Uzi and P bounce off of each other in this gleefully produced track; a nice break from some of the more emotional tracks of Luv Is Rage 2.

The song is also produced by Pharrell, and features his signature “four-count” intro.

description.plain:
“Dark Queen” serves as the 15th song on Lil Uzi Vert’s album Luv Is Rage 2.

On “Dark Queen”, Uzi shines a light on his relationship with his mother detailing his understanding of his mothers constant worry on Uzi’s condition, safety and well-being. Uzi acknowledges these worries while also admitting that he too shares her fears, however he firmly states that he was brought up to do what we know he does best.

description.plain:
The fifth track, “SideLine Watching (Hold Up)” on The Perfect Luv Tape is a song mainly centered around Uzi flexing his money and his new girls to his haters and to his ex-girl Brittany. Brittany and Uzi recently went through a break up, and on this song he tries to point out how he doesn’t need her ‘cause his new girl’s got what he needs.

A month before this track was posted, Uzi tweeted out that him and Britney were through.
https://twitter.com/LILUZIVERT/status/746739042818101249

description.plain:
13th track off Lil Uzi Vert’s album Luv Is Rage 2, produced by Maaly Raw, Metro Boomin and Pi'erre Bourne.

The track speaks about how Uzi and his ex’s last relationship ended and how he has felt ever since the breakup. It also talks about issues within the relationship and how little Lil Uzi Vert cares about the relationship as of now.

description.plain:
444 is a reference to JAY-Z and his 13th album 4:44. JAY-Z is namechecked in the song.

The sum of 444 and 222 is 666, or the Biblical “Number of the Beast,” commonly associated with Satan. In 2017, a theory that Uzi was associated with Satan gained traction online, citing evidence such as the similarity between “Lucifer” and “Lil Uzi Vert.” Uzi also wears an inverted cross, or the Cross of Saint Peter, as part of a necklace. Even though the symbol has its roots as a Christian symbol, it is also used to express anti-Christian sentiment and is popular in punk rock, a genre that Uzi draws inspiration from.



This song title, as well as some of the iconography from LUV is Rage 2 depicting Uzi with wings and horns, shows Uzi acknowledging or even embracing the theory.

description.plain:
Lil Uzi Vert reminisces his young life on 1600 Block in his home town of Philadelphia. He explores issues of distrust among those closest to him and mentions spells of disloyalty that have caused him to turn cold towards so called friends. Uzi also pays homage to his close friends Chico and Ninety who were killed in his neighborhood, expressing his sadness for his fallen brothers.

The song was released while he was on the European leg of The Weeknd’s Starboy: Legend of the Fall 2017 world tour. He released this song along with three others as a part of an EP titled Luv Is Rage 1.5.

Lil Uzi raps about having relations with a woman who he shouldn’t, but his urges—aided by copious drug use—take over and eventually he “takes the wheel” and has sex with her.

description.plain:
The outro track to The Perfect Luv Tape, where Lil Uzi and Future brag about their diamonds and lavish lifestyle.

This is Fewtch and Lil Uzi’s second collaboration, after “Too Much Sauce” from DJ Esco’s Project E.T.: Esco Terrestrial.

Literally I'm cold as fuck

Water cross on my neck

I might go to MIA
I ain't talking paper planes
On the block with all my chains
Got the money and the fame
You a lame that's a shame

All these diamonds ain't nobody cold as us
Literally I'm cold as fuck
I need Canadian Goose

[Intro]
That be Maaly Raw (yah!)

[Chorus]
Wake up every day, know that I am blessed, yah (yah!)

I'm a high roller, yah (what?)

You know I'm a high roller, yah (huh?) (yah!)

[Verse 1]

Ooh, I am a beast (yah!)
Look at my pockets, they so obese (damn!)
Yah, they so obese
I eat up and I just had a feast (yah!) (vroom!)

I put Louie V, Don C my wrists (woo!)
Ferragamo, that's all on my wrist (woo!)
I know that girl can really suck dick (yah!)

I pour lean up, right, that's so crisp (yah!)
Yah, um, she suck like a tick (yah!)

I swear to God, I really can't miss (what?)

Even if I miss, that shit a hit (yah!)

Spend my money then do it again (yah!)
Yah, woo, I swear, that girl, she a ten (huh?)
Yah, keep her around, I swear, that girl, she a gem
Yah, before I was on, yah, fucked on the twins (yah!)
Yah, before I was on, yah, fucked on the twins
Yah, Raf Simons, Rick Owens, little Phillip Lim
Yah, she said she ain't want me so I fucked her friend (yah!)
Yah, open up my mouth, white diamonds when I grin (yah!)
Yah, I am not from this Earth like Invader Zim (what?)
Yah, nowadays, I am on everybody kin (yah!)
Yah, walk around wit' my Barbie like I am Ken (yah!)
Yah, everyday adventure time, feelin' like I’m Finn
Yah, I might just put some diamonds all on my wrist (wow!)
Yah, every bitch in my face, don't give 'em kiss
Yah, boy, you hate 'cause you can't live your life like this (yah, yah!)

[Chorus]

Counting up my cake, getting all them checks

Why you want to hate, you do it the best
I'm a high roller
You know I'm a high roller

You know I'm a high roller

I swear to God she a ten
Keep her around I swear that girl she a gem

Raf Simons, Rick Owens, little Phillip Lim

Goyard bags cost more than your rent

Put my baby girl in Ferrari Moncler she bougie
Boy I'm cool everybody know you a shoobie
Nowadays I can't even go to the movies
Mood swing, mood swing girl you gon' lose me
Mood swing, mood swing girl you gon' lose me
Same thing over and over girl you can't fool me
Same thing over and over girl you can't fool me

description.plain: “Two®” marks Lil Uzi Vert’s first song of his album Luv Is Rage 2, and is named specifically to show Uzi’s transition from his 2015 album Luv Is Rage. On the track he discusses the fact that he now has money and power in the music industry. The song explains how “SoundCloud rappers” are biting his style and stealing his cadence to attempt to ride the wave for fame. The song also talks about how people should be thanking him for innovating the hip-hop industry because he feels like a lot of people wouldn’t be popping right now if it wasn’t for him and his crazy style.

description.plain:
Super Saiyan Trunks (simply titled “Super Saiyan” on his Luv Is Rage mixtape) is one of Uzi’s first breakthrough hits. It’s produced by Slade Da Monsta.

The name of this song comes from Uzi’s love of the popular animated series Dragon Ball Z, where powerful members of Saiyan race (including Trunks, one of the most powerful Saiyans in the world) can transform and go Super Saiyan.

description.plain:
After Lil Uzi announced August 25 as the release of Luv is Rage 2, snippets of the upcoming tracklist leaked online.

Originally meant for Belly’s mixtape Mumble Rap, The Weeknd’s feature steals the show. Tesfaye is one of only 2 features on the entire project.

description.plain:
Keeping up with the theme of the rest of the album, Uzi is again found rapping about his relationship with his now ex-girlfriend Brittany Byrd. Uzi uses the phrase “I can’t feel” as a lyrical motif throughout the song to emphasize his new found independence. He insists that despite his initial heartbreak he no longer has any need for love. His pain has numbed and he…

Don’t need nobody now

description.plain:
Continuing the concept in “You Was Right,” Uzi’s trying to get another chance with his baby.

This song was teased on Twitter in late March, not seeing it’s full release until the entire project dropped.

description.plain: Lil Uzi comes through with an inspirational track, focused around UFC fighter Ronda Rousey. Before her devastating loss to Holly Holm in 2015, Ronda was undefeated—but she’s expected to come back, and better than ever!

songs.title: How to Talk
songs.lyrics:
[Intro: DreamDoll]
And you didn't come here for me, let's talk about it
'Cause if you would have came here for me, that would've been planned
You would've put me on
You ain't say, "Oh I'm coming this day, I'm coming that"
You sit here and you tell me one thing and you always do another
'Cause, cause let me know, let me... let me tell you why
'Cause you're not a man of your word
That's - that's the reason why. So let's talk about it
Oh, you come here for nothing
No, you came here for what?
Whatever you came here for
So, whatever
You have no type of communication at all
So get up out my comments

[Chorus]
Talk to me nice (Skrrt)
Talk to me nice (Whatever)
Talk to me nice (Mhm)
Know I'm gon' ball yeah
No way I could fall, yeah (What?)
They predicted next fall yeah (What?)
Look at them, like, "Aw yeah" (No way)
Talk to me (Whoo)
Talk to me nice (Lil Uzi)
Talk to me nice (Uh-huh)
Talk to me nice (Come on)
Or don't talk to me at all, yeah (Nope)
On the way, one call yeah (Yeah)
Count it up and it's all there (Yeah)
Water hittin' look like small tears (Yeah)

[Verse 1]
Told her talk to me nice (Talk to me)
Talk to me nice (Whoo)
I say it once (Mm), I won't say it twice (Twice)
Okay might say it twice (Ouu), because I'm kinda high (Ouu)
Even though I'm so evil (Uh), I still look at the sky
And I ask why
Why I treat her like my dog, yeah
We supposed to be all here (Aw, yuh)
She got different color long hair
Pull up coupe, two small chairs (Skrrt)
Took that girl right in the club (Yuh)
Felt the booty and it's all there
So smooth so its all nair
Heard she talk to a ball player (What?) It's cool
Heard she talk to a ball player, but you know I keep it all player
And I heard he ain't a star player
I'm not worried, I'm a heartbreaker
I'm in outer space, on Mars faded
I'm not tryna make it R-rated (Yuh)
But my niggas look like Darth Vader (Yuh, yuh, yuh, aye)
Ohh, ohh

[Chorus]
Talk to me nice (Skrrt)
Talk to me nice (Whatever)
Talk to me nice (Mhm)
Know I'm gon' ball yeah
No way I could fall, yeah (What?)
They predicted next fall yeah (What?)
Look at them, like, "Aw yeah" (No way)
Talk to me (Whoo)
Talk to me nice (Lil Uzi)
Talk to me nice (Uh-huh)
Talk to me nice (Come on)
Or don't talk to me at all, yeah (Nope)
On the way, one call yeah (Yeah)
Count it up and it's all there (Yeah)
Water hittin' look like small tears (Yeah)

[Verse 2]
I was in a dream (Whoo)
Yeah I used to dream (Yup)
I was all a dream (Duh)
Now I'm in reality, don't need those
Fantasy, what I see, sleep when I'm woke (Yuh)
Real ones can't die (Lil Uzi), only multiply (Yup)
I know something it ain't right (Ooh), how you put me to the side? (Gee)
When I called your phone, yeah, you said I was lyin' (Lyin'?)
How am I lyin'? (What) I just pulled up to my show (Yuh)
I'm still on the grind
Heard you got a chauffeur (Heard dat, woo)
(Lil' Uzi, Lil' Uzi, Lil' Uzi, Lil' Uzi)
Talk to me nice, (I heard that) talk to me nice (Ya heard)
Heard she a Doll when she mad, why I flood her all in ice (Skrrt)
Ride it like a bike, bust me like a Sprite
Load up the jet for New York tonight

[Chorus]
Talk to me nice (Skrrt)
Talk to me nice (Whatever)
Talk to me nice (Mhm)
Know I'm gon' ball yeah
No way I could fall, yeah (What?)
They predicted next fall yeah (What?)
Look at them, like, "Aw yeah" (No way)
Talk to me (Whoo)

Talk to me nice (Uh-huh)
Talk to me nice (Come on)
Or don't talk to me at all, yeah (Nope)
On the way, one call yeah (Yeah)
Count it up and it's all there (Yeah)
Water hittin' look like small tears (Yeah)

[Outro]
Talk to me

description.plain:
One of the four songs released on the deluxe edition of Luv is Rage 2, “Loaded” is a braggadocious song about the extent of Uzi’s wealth. Uzi repeatedly states that he, and his pockets, are “loaded”, presumably with cash.

“Loaded” was originally premiered on the XM Radio Station Shade 45 completely unmixed, unmastered, and full of producer tags. This version, ripped directly from the stream, circulated on the internet for several months (most notably on the official “World Star Hip-Hop” YouTube channel).

description.plain: “Pretty Mami” was originally released as a rough cut in late July 2017 on Don Cannon and DJ Drama’s Shade 45 radio show under the alias “Let You Know”, along with three other songs. Uzi originally implied that these songs would not make the album, however “Pretty Mami” was evidently an exception, as well as “Loaded,” which is on the deluxe version of Luv Is Rage 2.

description.plain: In this ode to success, Uzi makes a toast to his accomplishments. Over melodic production by longtime collaborator DP Beats, Uzi returns to his signature sound. The lyrics continue to pay tribute to Uzi’s success and the opportunities that have inevitably come with the wealth, wealth that LUV intends to share with his day ones. During a lengthy intro Lil Uzi Vert pays respects to his fallen brothers while maintaining a light and playful mood with his friends Iky and Spikey.

description.plain:
The final track on Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World, Lil Uzi pays homage to the comic book series/movie Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World—the inspiration for this mixtape and the title.

“Scott and Ramona” relates Uzi’s love for his girlfriend Brittany to the fictional character Scott Pilgrim and his love interest Ramona Flowers in the movie Scott Pilgrim vs. The World.

description.plain: In Pokemon, Team Rocket is a criminal organization trio. Uzi compares himself and his girlfriend, Brittany, to Team Rocket in terms of hair color; Lil Uzi often dyes his hair bluish-purple like James' from the trio, and Brittany’s color is often pink like Jessie’s from the trio.

[Verse 1]

Yeah, got the rari, saw the Wraith, run it
Run it, run it, run it, run it, yeah
Now I'm on top of the game I remember I was nothing

Ooh, swim in it, ooh, let me touch it

Running back, running back, rush it
Yeah, in Atlanta, like I'm TJ Duckett

They some dogs need a muzzle
Baby girl turn around
I do not wanna cuddle
Damn you wet like a puddle

And I’m feeling myself
On a molly and an edible
Now your life is ahead of you
No one is ahead of you
Mike Tyson I'm impeccable
Man I swear that's what this bread'll do
Yeah, man I swear that's what this bread'll do (money money)
She took me in the backroom said see what this head'll do
Run it, run it, bitch, run it

[Hook 1]
Hundred thousand in jewelry
Told my jeweler run it
Why you keep talking bout money
Boy you ain't got no money
Why you keep on sneak dissing
Boy I am not no dummy

[Verse 2]
Got a white bitch her name Connie
Slide in the lamb like a Johnny
In LA TMZ run up on me, kicking the cam like karate
Yeah, in a Porsche, she in a Mazi'
She got pictures of me while I was sleep
Said she want fifteen thousand
Run it, run it, run it, run it
Once I pay that money
Lil bitch you is a done one
Big gun like I'm huntin'
My cousin was chopping them onions
Move that shit straight out the oven
Went on the block made a hundred
Yeah, went on the block made a hundred
Hundred thousand, all of my niggas they wilding
I'm a Vlone thug, thats why I'm stylish
My main girl I swear that she in college
She give me brain thats how I get knowledge
In that studio rocking that Alyx
Yeah, smokin' gas got me high like a pilot
Met a girl there she work at Follies
Met a girl that work at Magic City
The girl at follies she got the titties
The girl at Magic she got the body
On the real neither one of them fifty
Neither one of these girls get me, yuh
They only with me 'cause I got these hundreds and fifties
Lil Uzi don't move with no twenties
Funny thing is you really don't move with money
You still move with them tens and them fives
You still move with those nickels and dimes
You took that girl to um meet your mom
But I fucked that girl right on the come
Put them girls all in a line, boy, I'm not lyin'
Please do not get out of line, I'm a leo like lion
Huh, run it, run it, bitch, run it, yeah

[Hook 2]
Hundred thousand in jewelry
Told my jeweler run it
Why you keep talking bout money
Boy you ain't got no money
Why you keep sneak dissing
Boy I am not no dummy (no)
Got the 'rari, saw the Wraith, run it
Run it, run it, run it

description.plain:
VLone is a fashion brand started by A$AP Mob, specifically Bari and Rocky. Lil Uzi has a tattoo of the logo, and his collaborator/friend Playboi Carti even has a song named after the brand.

Uzi posted a video of himself listening to the song and flexing his VLone tattoo on twitter:

https://twitter.com/LILUZIVERT/status/779010135880568832

description.plain:
“Of Course” is a highly anticipated song expected to land on Lil Uzi Vert’s sophomore studio album, Eternal Atake.

The song was consistently previewed by many, even by Uzi himself during the Endless Summer Tour and on Instagram Live. It would eventually leak online on October 13, 2018, causing DJ Don Cannon to respond on Instagram:



Copyright strikes were later issued to uploads of the song on media sharing sites. The copyright message revealed the song’s title to be “Of Course Intro.” On November 28, 2018, producer TM88 took to Twitter to respond to a fan inquiring about tracks he’s produced on Eternal Atake. He revealed that he produced the intro track, confirming that “Of Course” is not actually the album’s first song.

songs.title: Boring Shit
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
I can be anything
Take a look, it's in a book
Take a look, it's in a book
I can be anything
Take a look, it's in a book
Take a look, it's in a book

[Verse 1]
Nowadays these niggas got tellin' ways
She like me when I was broke, now I am hella paid
Gettin' more money than that nigga that's sellin' weight
I can not hear y'all, loud radio, heavy bass
I get dough, pastries like I'm sellin' cake
Smoke gas 'til I levitate
You ain't never smoke that Jet Fuel
I got that from Uncle Snoop (yeah)
I kept that shit one seventy-five, like seven quarters
I fuck so much that I probably got like seven daughters
Boy you move too quick just like a rabbit
Run the game like tortoise
Fuck her to the morning
I think I'm immortal
I think I'm an alien
And got sent straight down from a portal (yeah)
Touch it from the back
And I swear that I won't record you (yah, yah)
Baby I'm not normal
Baby I'm not normal (no way)
They don't like us because we not normal
We can do anything and I won't bore you
It don't matter to you but you know I can afford you
You rock that Amethyst you know I can't ignore you
Watchin' Steven Universe, that's one hell of a story

[Hook]
You got guts, no glory, yeah
You got guts, no glory
You got guts, no glory

[Bridge]
Take a look, it's in a book
Take a look, it's in a book
Take a look, it's in a book
Take a look, it's in a book

[Verse 2]
I could build your confidence as you build mine
You like me, I will love you always until the end of time
It seems like that I'm always on that thin line
Like 808s & Heartbreak, Kanye with a little hentai
Samurai Jack on a journey, on my lonely, always rockin' Vêtements
They asked me can I rap, man can I?
But I chose to be a sharp shooter like Chris Benoit
Drivin' in that Lamb, I remember when my mom took me to PennDOT
Fucked a girl from Sweden, then I sent her ass to Denmark
Fucked a girl from L.A., and I left her ass right there
Of course you rock with me 'cause I just came out this year
But I'ma see if you really fuck with me if you listening next year
Countin' all my bands up
Go 'head, throw your hands up
Throw your... yeah
Go 'head throw your hands up
Mad because their...
Mad because their only chance up
Yeah your only chance up
And I really did it
You know I really did it
Yeah I really did it

[Outro]
It's in a book
The B-I-B-L-E-

description.plain:
“Left, Right” is Uzi and Carti’s strip club anthem—similar to “Left, Right” by YG and DJ Mustard.

Before its official release, the track was leaked as “Cannon,” but was renamed when it officially dropped. Uzi and Carti went on the Left, Right tour after this song.

description.plain:
Lil Uzi Vert released on his SoundCloud “Grow Up”, in which he raps about his haters.

The track delves into his brand of trap, it appears labeled as “Japanese Trap”.

It comes as one of three new songs that, on the same day, the Philly artist shared; the others are “Miss Cleo” and “Woke Up Thankful”.

body.plain:
Lil Uzi Vert released on his SoundCloud “Grow Up”, in which he raps about his haters.

The track delves into his brand of trap, it appears labeled as “Japanese Trap”.

It comes as one of three new songs that, on the same day, the Philly artist shared; the others are “Miss Cleo” and “Woke Up Thankful”.

description.plain: In his track “Malfunction” Lil Uzi Vert expresses his feelings after being with a girl (Brittany Byrd) who has ended her relationship and is now with someone else. Although the relationship has ended, Uzi has a bit of doubt saying, “Don’t seem to be over”. Regardless of his heartbreak, he makes it clear that he is much cooler than her new man and proves it through his flexing.

description.plain:
“Like Me” is expected to be featured on Lil Uzi Vert’s 2018 album, Eternal Atake.

In the song, Uzi touches upon his wealth largely spent on clothes, jewelry and cars, which makes other women choose him over their partner.

Before the song’s release, fans knew it as “Like Me” or “Myron.” It was previewed on Uzi’s Instagram on September 22, 2018, in a higher speed than the original version and as yet another dancing video following the snippet for the album’s lead single, “New Patek.” On November 28, 2018, Uzi previewed the original version of the song on his Instagram livestream, and played more than what was initially heard.

The World 2”. https://instagram.com/p/BZFtKlegg51/ This preview and announcement was posted nearly a month after his debut studio album “Luv is Rage 2”, and nearly a year after the first snippet that was supposed to be on “Luv is Rage 2”, which ended up not making it on the album https://instagram.com/p/BNVmmsHjJVu/

body.plain: This highly anticipated uzi and Chief Keef song will be dropping Friday, July 20th which is when LUV vs the world 2 is expected to drop. In a short clip uzi said “like I’m bout to drop” and got cut off so a release this week is probable

For me she's going down

I'm the shit and she know it now

Yeah, what

Yeah she in my kitchen whip it up like Benihana

You can not hold her, yeah

I ain't with that tellin' shit swear it ain't shit you keep tellin' me
He be hatin' cause where I am, he will never be (Come on girl)

Yeah, what

description.plain:
Uzi teased the second verse of this yet unreleased track on December 9th via Instagram.

The next day he performed the track during his set at the Ryan Centre at the University of Rhode Island:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kv7KqvWB2fU&feature=youtu.be&a

description.plain: Wit My Crew x 1987 is the 12th Track of Luv Is Rage. The song features a soft, mellow trap beat that finds Uzi’s calm voice vibing with the track – an instant highlight of the tape!

description.plain:
“Diamonds All on My Wrist” is the third new track that Lil Uzi Vert dropped on the deluxe version of his album Luv Is Rage 2. The song is produced by Bobby Kritical, who also did a collab with Uzi on “For Real”.

This song portrays part of Uzi’s persona that loves all the materialistic aspects of life–money, jewelry, women, cars, and so on. In all, he is doing what he often does; boasting about his wealth.

description.plain:
“Dolly” is a leaked song by Lil Uzi Vert, produced by Bugz Ronin.

The song seems to make references to Uzi’s frequent collaborator, Young Thug, and his younger sisters Dolly White (as per the title of the song and its chorus) and Dora.

The song was first teased by Uzi in early 2018 with fans expecting it to appear on either Lil Uzi Vert vs. The World 2, or some other upcoming project. Before this could happen, however, the secretive hacking group known as Music Mafia put the song up for the sale on their site.

The song was purchased from Music Mafia and it  leaked online on July 16, 2018.

description.plain:
Uzi trades his signature melodic style for a raw, no holds barred track featuring strong and aggressive delivery, reminiscent of his 2014 track “UZI”.

The song title is a reference to Rich the Kid’s label Rich Forever, indicating that this is indeed a response to Rich the Kids diss track, “Dead Friends”.

description.plain:
Lil Uzi pays tribute to the TV psychic Youree Dell Harris aka Miss Cleo and deals with success that is easy to go along with it;

The track was initially named “Water on My Diamonds” and was released on Soundcloud with “Grow Up” and “Woke Up Thankful”.

description.plain:
“Everything Lit” was initially announced by a leak. On the song, Uzi raps without his traditional auto-tune vocals over a haunting beat.

According to the source of the leak, it was recorded sometime in 2016 prior to “Money Longer”.

The song leaked online on July 23, 2018, shortly after “Introvert”.

description.plain:
“Alone Time” is a song that was leaked on July 9, 2017. It was produced by Maaly Raw and presumably marks the second release off of Luv Is Rage 2 .

This song describes Lil Uzi’s expensive taste and self-indulges into his life as a star. It also slightly dives into LUV’s status as a rockstar, which he has previously classified himself as.

description.plain:
In “1600,” Uzi gives a shout-out to the block in North Philadelphia where he was born and raised. He delivers raps about his newfound wealth, drugs, and designer brands—the typical flex from Uzi.

The long-awaited song was leaked on September 24, 2018, however, it was later revealed that the leak was of an early draft of “1600.” The final version of the song is expect to release on his upcoming sophomore album, Eternal Atake.

songs.lyrics:
Lyrics from Snippet

[Verse 1]
Super geeked up, walking on a tightrope
She think she in love, but just want my dough
I'm numb from the pain, all these girls are psycho
Drivin' in the Lamb, swerving round the potholes
Know I got my gun everywhere that I go
Tatted up my face, I look like a psycho
She think she in love, but just want my dough
I'm numb from the pain, all these girls are psycho
Rocking my suit like a mobster, rocking my suit like a model
None of these girls are my problem, none of these girls are my problem
Call that girl, suck, chew, and swallow, call that girl, suck, chew, and swallow
Numb from the pain 'cause I'm honest, only worried bout them dollar

[Chorus]
Hey, I done got numb from the pain
All of these girls the same
Who's the one to blame?
Nowadays, you not the same
I flood my wrist out today
I hit your girl in my Wraith
I hit your girl in my Wraith
In a spaceship, outer space
Geeking on Mars yesterday
Now I'm on Pluto today
I look the moon in its face
I look the moon in its face
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate

[Verse 2]
I gotta stack up my cake
Getting them chips like it's Lay's
Man, my donuts like it's glazed
Man, my donuts like it's glazed
You know she told me you lame
Me and you, boy, not the same
Don't give a fuck what you bang
1600 what I claim

[Interlude]
Bah
Doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot doot

[Verse 3]
My niggas aim at the brain
Nowadays, these niggas do anything just for the fame
You got a stick, I got a chopper
These bitches don't hit the same
Don't hit the same, like, boy, you not the same
What is you saying?
Turned to a fool with the K
Turned to a fool with the K
Get that girl out of my face
'Rari so fast, we race

[Chorus]
Hey, I done got numb from the pain
All of these girls the same
Who's the one to blame?
Nowadays, you not the same
I flood my wrist out today
I hit your girl in my Wraith
I hit your girl in my Wraith
In a spaceship, outer space
Geeking on Mars yesterday
Now I'm on Pluto today
I look the moon in its face
I look the moon in its face
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate

[Outro: Lil Uzi Vert]
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate
Me and the moon relate

description.plain:
Breaking out the auto-tune, DJ Drama’s protégé leads the record off by “countin” his money and women, while Wiz & 2 Chainz lay down their respective verses from A Milli Billi Trilli over the Murda Beatz-produced banger.

Serving as the follow up to “Money Longer,” “Countin” is another strong addition to Uzi’s steady growing catalogue of hits.

description.plain:
“Woke Up Thankful” was the third track released on November 8th via Uzi’s twitter. It was dropped shortly after the release of “Grow Up” and “Miss Cleo”, leading fans to speculate that this track was shared as a last minute decision due to the way Uzi uploaded and quickly deleted another track called “Water On My Diamonds”.

It’s another collaboration between Dp Beats and Uzi after the NY native produced “Ready Set Go” and “7AM”.

It was first posted via a snippet on Uzi’s Instagram.

body.plain:
“Woke Up Thankful” was the third track released on November 8th via Uzi’s twitter. It was dropped shortly after the release of “Grow Up” and “Miss Cleo”, leading fans to speculate that this track was shared as a last minute decision due to the way Uzi uploaded and quickly deleted another track called “Water On My Diamonds”.

It’s another collaboration between Dp Beats and Uzi after the NY native produced “Ready Set Go” and “7AM”.

It was first posted via a snippet on Uzi’s Instagram.

songs.title: XXL Freshman Freestyle: Lil Uzi Vert
songs.lyrics:
[Verse]
I met some homies make a night what I signed for
But that's okay, I stack my money, make it times four
Look at my shoes, yeah, you know them things be Tom Ford
Lil Uzi, July 31st, born in '94
All these boys hatin' on me, that's why I got this nine for
But you know I run the game just like I'm an athlete
Better yet, not an athlete, runnin' just like a track of me
Told that girl that she can't see me or can't meet me
Told that boy he can dress like me, but he can't be me
Told that boy I don't see no competition like I'm Stevie
And yeah, I don't believe in the devil, but I play with them Ouijas
Alright, hotter than wasabi, everybody know that
Huh, same class as my nigga 21 and Kodak
Huh, told that girl I got them diamonds on my teeth, that's Kodak
Better smile for me, huh, yeah, you better get wild for me
Yeah, look at that Rolly, girl, better tell the dial for me
Cause that thing don't tick, baby
Huh, you probably get hit, baby
Yeah, if that boy talkin' shit, then I turn that boy into a lick, baby
Forty shots for Lil Uzi, boy, I don't believe that
Huh, come into your hood, boy, yeah that's where we at
Yeah, where the weed at
Yeah, where the lick at
Yeah, boy stop all that talkin', I said where the bricks at
Yeah, you'll get hit back, break your neck like a Kit-Kat
Yeah, better get back, because this AK got that kick-back

description.plain:
“Introvert” is the name given an unreleased song by rapper Lil Uzi Vert. The song is dedicated to sleeping with women.

According to the source of the leak, the song has no real title: it’s thought to be an early concept for an intro track to Luv Is Rage; the name “Introvert” was given by fans.

The song leaked online on July 23, 2018, shortly before “Everything Lit”.

description.plain:
Uzi drops a random song before the release of Luv is Rage 2.

The repeated “Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah…” Bridge is a response to the criticism of new wave rappers over using the (yeah!) ad-libs.

The title “Uppin Downers” refers to Uzi mixing up the medicine using (Adderall), a prescription stimulant for ADD that is used to elevate and increase energy and focus. Molly and Adderall is the uppers, and the Xans, Percs, Lean are the downers.

Uzi takes the Adderall to keep him awake, but uses the Xans to calm down from the hyperactivity and feelings of anxiety—some side effects caused by taking Adderall.

Lil Uzi has mentioned popping Xans–amongst other drugs–frequently, like on “Money Longer,” “Safe House,” and “Canadian Goose.”

Funny, you can't turn me down
I already know nobody don't got my back
Yeah, yeah

[Chorus: Lil Uzi Vert]
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack, racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack, racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks

[Verse 1: Lil Uzi Vert]
Ooh
Boy, you cappin'
Boy, you cappin'
Ooh, you ain't put nothing on the map
Choppa on my lap
Ooh, she like when I pop them tags
Yeah, don't trip 'bout my tag, yeah
Get my swag from my dad, yeah
Hunnid bands in my bag
30 rounds in my mag
Fuck niggas bit my swag, ayy
I was just tryna walk past, yeah
Put your lil bitch on a jet
Then sucked my dick in your lap, yeah
Smile in the whip, drive fast
Goin' way faster than the Dash
Wanna race, boy, get dragged
Talking too slick, get clapped
Fucking your bitch, no fag
So fuck nigga better relax
'cause everything I say facts
Had to skate on a bitch like Vans
Been wearing these shits since The Pack
Ridin' 'round all black Mac
Know I gotta watch my back

[Chorus: Lil Uzi Vert]
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack, racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack, racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks

[Verse 2: Young Thug]
Kick my one-two, yeah, ooh
Fuck around, hunt you
Kick shit, Kung Fu
All my foreigns new
Pour my Mountain Dew
Diamonds from Cancun
Twenty bitches at the Fontainebleau (dramatic)
Psychic clowns, too
Your diamonds got clouds, too
Money tall need a ladder, too
Can't wait to embarrass you
I was thuggin' like a bastard too
I fuck like midnight blues
Three-hunnid for the big Bentley Coupe (Uh, yeah)
Wrist on froze like "Ouch"
Got a car in the house like a couch
Been rich, your bitch can vouch, yeah
Now bring your scout, yeah
I put my dick in her mouth, yeah
We was on your couch, yeah
I put my nut on her comb, now you got a nut in your hair
Chanel on her manicure
My flow means eleven
I got me a wife but, I still live like a bachelor
I told her we married
But I'm never 'gone marry her
I married the money and karats
I'm not tryna embarrass ya

[Chorus: Lil Uzi Vert]
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks
Bag, bag, bag, bag
Stack racks, racks, racks
Black Mac, stay strapped
Ooh, big racks
Ooh, large stacks

songs.title: Queso
songs.lyrics:
[Hook: Lil Uzi Vert]
My bitch Spanish, told her twerk, then she hit the salsa
You need twenty, thirty, forty, that's how much it cost ya'
Mixin' up that perico,  spread it on the table
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso

[Verse 1: Lil Uzi Vert]
Money, carat, diamond necklace
Thousand dollar checklist
Bitch, I'm flexin', we start sexin'
Now that bitch so restless
Panamera Rari, forgi, bitch, I'm young and reckless
My chain got on praying hands
'Cause my life a blessin'
We start smokin' in the dams
Now I smoke a section
You is not allowed in the real nigga section
Hundred dollar, salad, fifty dollar dressin'
Money, pussy, sober, they can't smell stressin'
Daylight, hoes is whippin' lotus
They so poker, built like joker
Glock no holster (pistol burning)
Pockets on Al Roker
Lean or soda, what you holdin'?
My bitch golden, her ass swollen
Gucci Jones and why you foldin'?
Your bitch hatin' on my homies

[Interlude 1]
That queso, that queso, that queso
Hey, hey, hey, hey

[Hook: Lil Uzi Vert]
My bitch Spanish, told her twerk, then she hit the salsa
You need twenty, thirty, forty, that's how much it cost ya'
Mixin' up that perico, spread it on the table
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso

[Verse 2: Wiz Khalifa]
Fuck your man, bitches wanna fuck with Young Khalifa
'Cause I got that sauce, I be bunkin' through your speakers
Married to the money, fuck her once, then I don't need her
Big booty Latina, twerkin', while she roll my weed up
All my niggas on, Lil' Uzi hit me for a feature
Never trust a broad, ya'll some unstable creatures
Chevy get the call, I'm in Cali', we should link up
Back when I was young, servin' strong in-front the teachers
Now I'm much older, prices way cheaper
Came a long way from that Motorola beeper
Movin' state to state with just an iPhone and a Sidekick
Upgrade the room and get a flight for my lil' side bitch

[Interlude 2]
That queso, that queso, that queso
Hey, hey, hey, hey

[Hook: Lil Uzi Vert]
My bitch Spanish, told her twerk, then she hit the salsa
You need twenty, thirty, forty, that's how much it cost ya'
Mixin' up that perico, spread it on the table
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso
My plug good, he mix the yayo, queso, queso, queso

description.plain: Lil Uzi Vert is known for his excessive drug use perpetuated throughout numerous of his songs. In “Queso' he is referring to his cocaine which is high quality when mixed with other additives.
